page.title: 06STORNOWAY SOUTH - INDUSTRY
page.content:
{Lewis Offshore Ltd,}manufactures heavy equipment for numerous oil companies. In{1985}there are{350}people employed. They work 24 hours a day in three 8 hour shifts except on Sundays. Lewis Offshore uses{35,000}units of electricity per day to produce oil or gas related heavy steel fabrication. To do this they need{cranes, burning {machines, rolling machines and welding {machines. The advantages of being based in the Western Isles are deep water facilities and a pool of local labour. The firm came to Lewis in{1974.}It was then owned by{FRED OLSEN Ltd.}In{1982 the{HEEREMA}group took over.
{ {
